Member Function Documentation

bool pandora::ClusterHelper::CanMergeCluster ( const Cluster *const   pCluster,
const float  minMipFraction,
const float  maxAllHitsFitRms 
) [static]

Whether a cluster can be merged with another.

Uses simple suggested criteria, including cluster photon id flag and supplied cuts on cluster mip fraction and all hits fit rms.

Parameters:
pCluster address of the cluster
minMipFraction the minimum mip fraction for clusters (flagged as photons) to be merged
maxAllHitsFitRms the maximum all hit fit rms for clusters (flagged as photons) to be merged
Returns:
boolean

bool pandora::ClusterHelper::DoesClusterCrossGapRegion ( const Cluster *const   pCluster,
const PseudoLayer  startLayer,
const PseudoLayer  endLayer,
const unsigned int  nSamplingPoints = 50 
) [static]

Whether a linear fit to a cluster crosses a registered gap region.

Only the region between the startlayer and endlayer is considered in the fit and in the comparison with registered gap regions.

Parameters:
pCluster address of the cluster
startLayer the start layer (adjusted to maximum of specified layer and cluster inner layer)
endLayer the end layer (adjusted to minimum of specified layer and cluster outer layer)
nSamplingPoints number of points at which to sample the fit within the specified layer region
Returns:
boolean

bool pandora::ClusterHelper::DoesFitCrossGapRegion ( const ClusterFitResult &  clusterFitResult,
const CartesianVector &  startPosition,
const float  propagationDistance,
const unsigned int  nSamplingPoints = 50 
) [static]

Whether a linear fit crosses a registered gap region.

The fit will be propagated through the specified distance from its closest approach to the startPosition. Within this propagation, the fit will be sampled a specified number of times and the resulting position compared with registered gap regions.

Parameters:
clusterFitResult the clsuter fit result
startPosition the propagation start position (adjusted to closest point on fit trajectory)
propagationDistance the propagation distance, which can be negative for propagation towards the ip
nSamplingPoints number of points at which to sample the fit within its propagation
Returns:
boolean

const unsigned int  maxOccupiedLayers,
ClusterFitResult &  clusterFitResult 
) [static]

Fit points in last n occupied pseudolayers of a cluster.

float pandora::ClusterHelper::GetDistanceToClosestCentroid ( const ClusterFitResult &  clusterFitResult,
const Cluster *const   pCluster,
const PseudoLayer  startLayer,
const PseudoLayer  endLayer 
) [static]

Get closest distance of approach between projected cluster fit result and layer centroid position of a second cluster.

Parameters:
clusterFitResult the fit result to the first cluster
pCluster address of the second cluster
startLayer first layer to examine
endLayer last layer to examine
Returns:
the closest distance of approach

PseudoLayer pandora::ClusterHelper::GetShowerStartLayer ( const Cluster *const   pCluster  )  [static]

Get the layer at which shower can be considered to start; this function evaluates the the starting point of a series of "showerStartNonMipLayers" successive layers, each with mip fraction below "showerLayerMipFraction".

Parameters:
pCluster address of the cluster
Returns:
The shower start layer

StatusCode pandora::ClusterHelper::GetTrackClusterDistance ( const Track *const   pTrack,
const Cluster *const   pCluster,
const PseudoLayer  maxSearchLayer,
const float  parallelDistanceCut,
float &  trackClusterDistance 
) [static]

Get the distance of closest approach between the projected track direction at calorimeter and the hits within a cluster.

Note that only a specified number of layers are examined.

Parameters:
pTrack address of the track
pCluster address of the cluster
maxSearchLayer the maximum pseudolayer to examine
parallelDistanceCut maximum allowed projection of track-cluster separation along track direction
trackClusterDistance to receive the track cluster distance

bool pandora::ClusterHelper::IsClusterLeavingDetector ( const Cluster *const   pCluster  )  [static]

Whether a cluster should be considered as leaving the calorimeters, leading to leakage of its energy.

Parameters:
pCluster address of the cluster
Returns:
boolean
